intro: Linaria grossheimii, commonly known as the Cape honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant orange to yellow tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, narrow, and slightly hairy, while the flowers are clustered in spikes. Linaria grossheimii is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils.
